boardgame.name: In the Heart of the Forest
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

An atmospheric one-shot adventure set in a dark forest for one-on-one or parties of level 5 or 6.

There are two new sidekick classes, NPCs, and leveling tables included with handouts for your player!

In this adventure, the characters gather information in the small village of Redvale on the outskirts of the Blackwoods Forest. They go into the forest in search of Adelle, a druid whose other eleven Circle members have disappeared within the last year.

Inside the forest, they discover several undead beings, including a wood woad, who guides them to Adelle. She and her Circle learned a year before of a sorceress’s plan to extend her power beyond the forest, a death sentence for the village of Redvale and the lands beyond. Adelle is the last one left.

Adelle is suspicious of the party at first, but she might help them get to the center of the forest to investigate the dark sorceress and try to put a stop to her destructive plans.

This adventure sets a mysterious woodland ambiance that lends itself to an immersive one-shot experience!
This Adventure Includes:

Full one-shot adventure for levels 5 or 6
Two sidekick characters (or DMPCs) with handouts for your player
Two new sidekick classes and unique leveling tables: the archer and the Circle of the Phoenix druid
Mechanics for running a sidekick
Beautiful art
Well-rounded NPCs
Two custom NPC stat blocks
A new custom creature and
Two custom magical items

boardgame.name: Totems of the Svalich Woods
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

A one-on-one Curse of Strahd adventure!

For DMs and players of Curse of Strahd, Totems of the Svalich Woods is a one-shot side quest for one player and one DM or an additional Barovian adventure for duet CoS campaigns!

Several forms of darkness permeate this adventure. The twisted, primal evil of the Svalich Woods and the Dark Powers represents one manifestation, but the town of Barovia and its traditions encompass another.

Adventurers must resist both of these expressions of darkness to help a distressed young man. The village sent his sister into the forest as a sacrifice to the dark being that dwells within. Ultimately, this rescue quest leads to a confrontation with the leshen, an undead hunter who serves as the forest’s spirit guardian and enforces the Dark Powers’ whims.

This adventure takes place outside the village of Barovia and functions as a side quest or one-on-one session in a Curse of Strahd campaign. It could also be placed in the Forgotten Realms, at the edge of the Cold Wood, for instance, or any homebrew location that has dark forests.

This adventure assumes that you have access to the Players Handbook, the Monster Manual, Curse of Strahd, Volo’s Guide to Monsters, and the Dungeon Master’s Guide. Items or creatures not referenced in these texts will be referenced in the appendices.

If you’re looking for an intense and atmospheric adventure deep in the Svalich Woods, you’ve found it.
This Adventure Includes:

Full one-shot adventure for levels 7 or 8
One sidekick character (or DMPC)
Beautiful art
Well-rounded NPCs
Three new creatures and
Two custom magical items

boardgame.name: The Proving Glade
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Proving Glade is a one-shot adventure meant for parties or duets.
Your characters arrive in a small settlement that has a big problem. The forest, its lifeblood, has seemingly withdrawn its bounty. Others have gone in, only to return hours later confused about how they got out.

Will your party have the wherewithal to navigate the treacherous forest, pass its surprising tests, and uncover what’s truly going on?
I wanted a forest adventure that felt alive and busy. I also didn’t want every encounter to be solved with the swing of a sword. The Proving Glade is about questioning value, morality, judgement, and redemption.

This adventure was written as part of the Summer 2019 RPG Writer's Workshop. We also submitted In the Heart of the Forest. While these two adventures are not necessarily connected, they both involve navigating difficult and dangerous scenarios in a forest and could naturally be strung together.

This Product Includes

A 3 to 4 hour one-shot designed for parties or 1-1 play.
A new Sidekick stat block: Daelin Hoofbane, ranger extraordinaire.
A new custom creature: the mysterious and powerful Alseiad, a glade nymph of incredible beauty.
2 new maps: One region map for tha forest around Quaervarr near Silverymoon and one battle map for The Hydra's Mire.

boardgame.name: There's Snow Place Like Home
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Dashing through the snow,
Running as fast as they can,
Hungry for some gnomes,
But they’d settle for some Man…
-Traditional Cheerington song warning children about the region’s reindeer

Steal gifts! Fight Reindeer! Save the holidays!

Take on the dreaded devil Belsnickel and save the snowy gnomish town of Cheerington from his grasp in this fun-filled adventure for one-on-one parties or small groups level 4-5.

Inside you'll find:

A one-shot adventure involving roleplay, exploration, and combat!
4 new festive creatures!
2 maps ready for print or import!
6 exciting new magical items to gift to your players!


This adventure also has lots of fun mechanics like mistletoe and corrupting coal!

We put together some of our favorite wintery stories and holiday tales in this fun holiday one-shot! It's perfect for a side narrative to try out one-on-one play for the first time, introducing someone new to the game, or taking your party to a festive demiplane for a unique Christmas-y one-shot adventure.

boardgame.name: The Face of the Temptress
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Twenty Seven Hundred years ago Bassanta was a sorceress of incredible beauty - and subtlety. She was a temptress, blackmailer, influence peddler, and rumour longer. On her whim simple soldiers could rise to riches or power, businesses could grow or crumble, and people could die. She was called "The Whisper-Queen of Lantash." And the known world feared her...

...but Lantash is gone and forgotten. It's people dust and bones in buried ruins. Her great power: less than a footnote in history. The great and terrible Whisper Queen died in the same disaster as thousands of her country-folk. The gods of Lantash, in their cold wisdom saw that the Hell she had earned would be not nearly as cruel as allowing Bassanta to linger on the mortal plane and see how little her Empire came to.

The Face of the Temptress is a simple meta-adventure; it is several events that occur during rest and downtime leading up to a final encounter. The events can be interspersed during and between several other adventures.

The adventure begins when the PCs collect a haunted object shrouded in illusions. The undead spirit clinging to it begins the process of manipulating and eventually possessing one of the PCs. A final showdown occurs when the PCs try to exorcise their possessed companion or the object.

This module was written to work with any OSR system using BECMI as a reference.
I have noted both ascending and descending armour classes and both a ThAC0 and Attack Bonus to accomodate more modernized systems.
I have also referred to OSRIC to offer Advanced-compatible spells.
boardgame.rpg: Old School Reference and Index Compilation (OSRIC)

boardgame.name: Into the Wizard's Hookah
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Into the Wizard's Hookah is a five-room dungeon with a wierd psychadelic vibe for 3-5 characters levelled 3-5 in any OSR system.

Help a friend whose mind is lost adrift on the Astral Plane with the help of a crazed hookah-smoking monk! Travel into a psychadelic inner-world dungeon and navigate strange traps that require a calm head in order to forge a holy relic designed to heal an impossible wound.

Inspired by Psychedelic media like the music of Glitter Wizard, the books of Terrence McKenna, and the Art of Mobius... with just a dash of H.P. Lovecraft.
Built around low-level planar travel.
Filled with classic Old-School monsters and tricks.
Introduces two unique magic items.
Written using OSRIC and B/X.
boardgame.rpg: Old School Reference and Index Compilation (OSRIC)

boardgame.name: Alchemy Poisons 2
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

This apocrypha further expands the amount of options available for poisoners and workers of blighted craft that interact with the world. Whether you want to enhance your allies or debilitate your foes, there is something for you in Alchemy Poisons 2!

boardgame.name: The Playroom VR
boardgame.description: A free release included with Playstation VR. It is a collection of mini-games with a casual party atmosphere used to demonstrate the capability of Playstation VR and augmented reality. - written by Bowman21

boardgame.name: Magic Knight Rayearth 2: Making of Magic Knight
boardgame.description:
User Summary

Magic Knight Rayearth 2: Making of Magic Knight is an RPG based upon the Magic Knight Rayearth manga and anime series.

boardgame.name: D100 Dungeon: Mapping Game â€“ Extra Gold
boardgame.description:
The D100 DUNGEON MAPPING GAME EXTRA GOLD pack, contains the 60 gold counters found in the D100 DUNGEON MAPPING GAME ADD-ON. They can be used either with the mapping game add-on to bolster your gold coin number, or if you don’t own the MAPPING GAME you can always use them as an alternative way to keep track of your adventurer’s gold and save some erasing on the adventure sheet.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: 100 Cybernetic Sensors for Cyber City
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Cyber sensors allow you to see the world in all of it’s technocolor glory. Whether you’re interfacing with a machine, entering the net, listening to subsonic communications, boosting your sensors or reflexes, or extending your mini-probe into a new cadaver, all of these senses and many more can be installed in your technologically enhanced avatar for a price.

This list gives you a broad range of sensors and communication devices to define your next despot, hero, mercenary, or punk. This list is intended for any dark future setting (like Cyberpunk, Shadowrun, Rifts, or any modern superhero settings) where technology is running rampant, and cybernetics are common. The list is system agnostic so that it can be easily applied to any system’s next cybercop, up and coming sociopath, or a paranoid street fixer clinging to power. This tool gives you dozens of different ways to upgrade your next would-be spy.

boardgame.name: 100 Methods of Coercion in Cyber City
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

This list is intended for any dark future setting where technology is running rampant, and corporations, military, government and organized crime are common. Use this list on a new punk trading money for some of their freedom, a corporate scientist too important to lose, or to stop a “made man” from becoming a rat. We recommend 2 or 3 rolls on the table, depending on how invested the controlling agency feels they need to be. So, are you ready to make a deal?

boardgame.name: 100 Knowledge Chips for Cyber City
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Skills chips are small slivers of computer chips coated in protective plastic that are imprinted with data software that defines a skill so that people who use them have a basic grasp of some teachable knowledge without months of study. This list provides skill chips filled with knowledge and culture, and you can use it to add details to an international assassin, a touch of worldly knowledge to a Cop, or a desperate visitor to a backwater hellhole.

This tool is intended for any dark future setting (like Cyberpunk, Shadowrun, Rifts, Gamma World, etc.) where technology is running rampant. Each of these knowledge skills are interesting areas of information that are useful for leading a double life, enjoying a foreign land, or rounding out a life with interesting worldly expertise. This roleplaying tool gives you dozens of different ways to add a new dimension to your next urban adventurer.

boardgame.name: 100 Reflex Chips for Cyber City
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Skills chips are small slivers of computer chips coated in protective plastic that are imprinted with data software that defines a skill so that people can have a basic grasp of some teachable knowledge without months of study. This list provides skill chips filled with programming to direct muscle memory and neural directions associated with physical activity. This tool can be applied to a seasoned corporate, an upcoming common soldier, or as a grim reminder of the past.

This tool is intended for any dark future setting (like Cyberpunk, Shadowrun, Rifts, Gamma World, etc.) where technology is running rampant. This roleplaying tool gives you dozens of different ways to add a new dimension to your next soldier of fortune.

boardgame.name: 100 Language Chips of Cyber City
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Skills chips are small slivers of computer chips coated in protective plastic that are imprinted with data software that defines a skill so that people can have a basic grasp of some teachable knowledge without months of study. This list provides skill chips filled with languages, and you can use it to add details to a cooling corpse, a touch of worldly knowledge to a Euro assassin, or to level the playing field for a stranger in a strange land.

This tool is intended for any dark future setting (like Cyberpunk, Shadowrun, Rifts, Gamma World, etc.) where technology is running rampant. Each of the languages in this list are still spoken by millions, are used by spies as a rare “secret tongue”, or are dead languages (marked by an *). This roleplaying tool gives you dozens of different ways to add a new dimension to your next urban survivor.

boardgame.name: 100 Items in a Gangster's Pocket
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

This list is intended for any roaring 20’s or depression-era 1930’s game world (like Gangbusters, Call of Cthulhu, Pulp Hero, Justice Inc., etc.) where the roots of society are changing and corruption and criminals are common. This list can be applied to a cooling corpse, an arrested mobster, or a criminal with either a heart of gold or a mind of hate. This roleplaying tool gives you dozens of different ways to add a new dimension to your next gangster.

boardgame.name: 100 Naughty Horse Behaviors
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

This list is intended for any Wild West, modern or fantasy setting where the land is vast and wide, and fresh secrets are plentiful and ever-present in a new world. This list can be applied to a horse stolen off a town’s hitching post, a new one purchased off a rancher, or even just one found lost in the prairie. Each entry includes the formal name of the behavior (if there is one) and the type of naughty behavior being displayed. This roleplaying tool gives you dozens of different ways to add a new dimension of personality to any horse without a significant outlay of time and energy.

boardgame.name: 100 Horse Companions
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Horses provide a sense of primordial power and motion to the Wild West. So why not take the utmost advantage of that sensation in your fantasy or Wild west game where the faithful steed is too often simply a pile of number and has no real appearance, personality or spirit? We can and should do better than that.

This list is intended for any Wild West or fantasy setting where the land is vast and wide, and fresh secrets are plentiful and ever-present in a new world. This list can be applied to a horse found in the wilderness away from it’s owner, a new purchased horse needed for the job, or even just one grabbed when the bank robbery went all wrong. Each entry includes a name, the sex of the horse, the breed and the disposition of the horse. This roleplaying tool gives you dozens of different ways to add a new dimension of personality to a loyal companion without an outlay of time and energy.

boardgame.name: 100 Things Behind that Dungeon Door
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

So you are making up that big dungeon to end all dungeon and the one thing that you want a lot of is doors… right? Stuff for the characters to choose and enter. But what to put behind these doors? The basic stuff or perhaps something crazy and out there? We get you… and here’s what we have to offer! This list provides 100 different things that you would find behind a dungeon door in a high fantasy setting. Some things are pretty normal and many other things are not… some are just downright weird or tricky in nature! Roll the percentile dice to some randomness or choose from the list what you want to put behind the doors of that crazy, hazard filled dungeon!

boardgame.name: 50 Scoundrels
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Thieves, looters, brigands, robbers, cutthroats, hired blades, vultures among men… all of them scoundrels. A staple of the fantasy genre, especially gritty urban fantasy settings, these lowlife dogs often go nameless and lacking in detail. Not anymore!

boardgame.name: 50 Scoundrels 2
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Thieves, looters, brigands, robbers, cutthroats, hired blades, vultures among men… all of them scoundrels. A staple of the fantasy genre, especially gritty urban fantasy settings, these lowlife dogs often go nameless and lacking in detail. Not anymore!

boardgame.name: 100 Overheard Cyber City Chatter V 08.0
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

The city overwhelms the senses. Neon against rainy black sky, reflecting in the puddles. Smells of things out of the sewers mix with the deep fried offerings of street vendors. Stale sweat so heavy in the air you can taste it. The most overwhelming of all is the sound… especially the endless sea of chatter. This list provides 100 random things that a group of heroes might hear in a cyberpunk city setting. Some things are worth taking note of, other things are just verbal garbage.

boardgame.name: 100 High School Kids 11
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

This list contains 100 different kids you would find in a high school setting. Included is first and last name, gender, class (Freshman, Sophomore, Junior, Senior), and a clique/interest/group that the kid associates with (or is lumped into). Perfect for a variety of modern settings– from light hearted to teen drama to crime, also good for low level supers (particularly teen supers), teenage horror heroes/vampire killers. Also usable for early post apocalypse settings, zombie outbreaks, and/or some cyberpunk/dystopia use. Basically if you need teens and it would be good to know what clique they fit into (or didn’t) here is the list for you...

boardgame.name: 100 Professionals Set 11
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

This list contains 100 different professionals that are perfect drop ins for a modern/crime role playing game. This list is also useful for survivors for a post apocalyptic or zombie outbreak setting as well as a cyberpunk/near future dystopia that has many existing modern day occupations and elements. Included in each entry is first and last name, gender, age, and occupational skill/role.

boardgame.name: 100 Alien Biome Locations 09
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Need to flesh out some quick locations for that planet the characters are on but you don’t have time to think up anything? Use this list instead! This product features 100 space age locations that can be dropped on to most worlds. Included is a full name (with geographic type) as well as some notable feature or something the characters would find in the particular location.

boardgame.name: 100 Alien Biome Locations 10
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Need to flesh out some quick locations for that planet the characters are on but you don’t have time to think up anything? Use this list instead! This product features 100 space age locations that can be dropped on to most worlds. Included is a full name (with geographic type) as well as some notable feature or something the characters would find in the particular location.

boardgame.name: Sherlock's Mysteries
boardgame.description:
Sherlock's Mysteries: Lucid Dreaming is an incredibly detailed and interactive puzzle adventure in the world of Sherlock Holmes available in both Journal and Puzzle Box formats. Solve puzzles, unravel enigmas, decipher codes & step inside the Mind Palace of Sherlock Holmes, as you race to save the life of the World's Greatest Detective.

The Journal seamlessly blends a narrative murder mystery experience with the puzzle and enigma solving that you would find in an escape room game. With more than 150 puzzles ranging from ciphers and codes to association and logic.

boardgame.name: Mega Station X - Neoretro Neon Wave Extravaganza
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Mega Station X – Neoretro Neon Wave Extravaganza is an ultra-massive 340 x 340 grid map comprised of 100 34 x34 unique geomorphic interlocking maps (each section can be rotated 90-degrees in any direction as well as inverted to link directly to any other map in the series).

To scale, using all 100 maps in a 10 x 10 array, Mega Station X creates an incredibly huge 2,890,00 square-foot space station map. Over ¾ of square kilometer consisting of over 3,500 individual rooms and hundreds of miles of networked corridors.

This product contains both High-Resolution (5,100 x 5,100 px 600 dpi] and VTT-Ready (1,800 x 1,800 px @ 300 dpi) versions of all 100 maps. Can be used to make multiple smaller maps or virtually endless combinations of massive maps. Corner and edge-cap maps also included.

boardgame.name: Cratered Dirt Road
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

This full color battlemap is the 506th of a series featuring various terrains. This installment of the battlemap series features a dirt road and especially the deep and wide crater blocking it.

The map is 28 x 30 squares in size, with each 1 inch square scaled to represent 5 feet. It is provided in 12 segments, which need to be assembled, in a single PDF using the letter format.

The product has been updated to include a large gridless JPG image of the map, intended for use with VTT software. It is 2016x2160 pixels in size at 72dpi.

boardgame.name: Rucksack (Issue 1 - July 2020)
boardgame.description:
Rucksack is a zine for the Quest RPG, and it's... pretty much what it says in the title; a bag of useful stuff.

In this issue:


A quick article on play as performance, and some improv notes.
A "name sheet" for quickly naming NPCs and keeping track of who's who.
A "learned abilities" sheet for tracking those cleanly.
A cheat sheet for how to make a roll, which includes additional tools and references for improvising setbacks and crits.
A page of 'stakes on cards', noting possible results for some swashbuckling action.
A blank set of card stakes, to record rolls you want to repeat or prep in advance.
Hacks for advenure points, inventory, and making rolls more skill-like.
A quick discussion of the license for Quest and use of it.

boardgame.name: Dwar7s Spring: Enchanted Forest
boardgame.description: The Enchanted Forest Expansion adds content to both Dwar7s Winter & Dwar7s Spring by adding buildings, new monsters, and giving the players options to upgrade their dwarfs.

boardgame.name: Dwar7s Spring: Elven Uprising
boardgame.description:
We are the children of the woods, creatures of magic. For centuries we shared this valley, living in peace with our bearded fellows... But their greedy expansion confined monsters to our lands, threatening the very existence of the faeries. This has to change!

The elves have a unique empire board featuring asymmetric gameplay. They have no agriculture so you will need to hunt.

Special Abilities: Archery - When fighting a monster, elves in adjacent locations also take part in the fight.

Faerie Dust - You get faerie cards in the production phase.

Faerie Folk - If you build your fortress, ever 2 faerie cards in your hand gives you plus 1VP at the end of the game.

Elven Magic - Your faerie power can go up to 3 making your faerie cards even stronger.

Dragon King - As a free action, pay 2 gold to replace one of you elves with the Dragon king. When harvesting or fighting, the Dragon King awards you as many hero cards as you have faerie power.

Note: Elven Uprising is an expansion that is compatible with Dwar7s Winter too, adding a new tribe to the game.

Title: Dwar7s Spring: Elven Uprising Publisher: Vesuvius Media Language(s): English

boardgame.name: Heisting the Skyvault
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

The players are recruited to go on a mission to steal an item from a vault.

boardgame.name: Endless Blue - The Price of Progress
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Tired of subsisting while others prosper, a local nomadic tribe abandoned their ancient tradition of harmony with nature to begin strip-mining for precious stones. The local hag, aghast at the destruction to the environment, threatens to kill them if they do not stop. Stuck in the middle, the adventurers must resolve the conflict before it is too late: make them stop or they will die...

boardgame.name: The Hallowed Halls of the Barbarian King
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Golthar the Mighty was a fearless warrior and a mercurial king. In his time he was considered the greatest barbarian to draw breath in this world. While much of the specific detail that was known of Golthar has passed from memory, some remains legend among those peoples whose ancestors were conquered beneath his greatsword.

boardgame.name: Prof. Filbert's Flying Laboratory
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Your party was fighting a giant griffin when it took off from the ground, dragging the entire party with it. It took you to a giant system of flying buildings, connected with narrow walkways, and held aloft with magic steam thrusters.

boardgame.name: Springtime in Shadows
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

A usurper and unstable pretender to the throne has begun imprisoning all dissidents who opposed him.

Your friend, one such dissident who holds important information which could bring down the new malevolent king, is being held in the jail in the town of Riverbend.

boardgame.name: Give Me the Brain: Superdeluxe Edition
boardgame.description:
Note: The Superdeluxe edition has 100 cards. The prior two versions had 112. A few of the worst and / or most confusing cards were removed, and a few difficulty numbers were adjusted.

The following cards were dropped:
One out of three copies of "Are You Still Serving Breakfast?"
One out of three copies of "Is This Meat Vegetarian?"
One out of two copies of Someone Loses An EYE.
Both copies of Scrambling Practice.
One out of two copies of Extra Hand.
Both copies of Sharing is Caring.
Graveyard Shift.
"I'd Like That With NO BUN."
Bid 29 card
Bid 30 card

About the game:
Welcome to Friedey's, the Fast Food Restaurant of the Damned, where the poor Zombies have only one Brain to pass around.

You're a Zombie working at a fast-food joint, and you must finish a handful of chores before you can go home.

Some of these chores are so complicated that they require a Brain. Or, rather, THE Brain, since there's only one.

Give Me the Brain is an award-winning classic card game by James Ernest, where the goal is simply to empty your hand.

You'll need a little luck, a little skill, and a little patience.

But mostly, you'll need to get your hands on that Brain.

- description from the back of the box

boardgame.name: Stilicho: Last of the Romans
boardgame.description:
The Goths are marching on Rome! In Gaul, Vandals and Alans pour across the Rhine. Meanwhile, a usurper from distant Britannia has raised his standard. The survival of the Western Empire depends on one man: Flavius Stilicho, barbarian general, commander-in-chief of the armies of Rome, and defacto ruler of the West.

STILICHO: LAST OF THE ROMANS is the long-anticipated follow-up to designer Robert DeLeskie's popular and challenging solitaire game WARS OF MARCUS AURELIUS. The brain-boiling card angst and nail-biting combats that made that game so compelling are back, along with some new wrinkles that make for a more challenging and nuanced decision space. For example, the Surge mechanism that caused so many gamers to invent new curse words is now more nefarious, with each enemy card having specific surge effects. Rome's enemies sometimes bump into each other, resulting in enemy-on-enemy battles. Regions might go into revolt, garrisons might defect to the banner of the pretender Constantine III, and the wily courtier Olympius might turn the emperor Honorius against you.

No wonder the historical Stilicho only lasted until turn 3! If you want to win, you'll have to last much longer than that, all while taking on tougher and more resilient enemies than poor Marcus had to face, and with less resources at your disposal. Will you prevent the sack of Rome and the fall of the Western Empire?

-description from publisher
boardgame.boardgamehonor: 2020 Charles S. Roberts Best Ancients to Medieval Board Wargame Nominee
2020 Charles S. Roberts Solitaire/Coop Board Wargame Nominee
boardgame.boardgameaccessory: Stilicho: Last of the Romans â€“ Canvas Map

Boxed edition, played once but in like new condition.
Payment is via PayPal friends and family.
Can be posted to addresses in the UK only, or collected from Birmingham.

boardgame.name: The Temple of Stone & Slime
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Long ago, a summoner bound three earth elementals in the form of giant stone heads. The summoner is long gone, but the elementals remain. They desperately wish to free themselves from their statuesque prisons, but can only do so if their hexes are broken in a specific way.

boardgame.name: Procedural PolyHedron Prison
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

To generate the prison:

(1) Roll a (d8) to identify the Room Shape
(2) Describe the variables of the Room to the USERS
(3) For the Room Shape, use the Encounter Roll dice

(3a) If the Encounter asks you to roll dice, do so


(4) Roll for next Room Shape (d8). Exit prison on a 1

boardgame.name: Shrine of the Slithering Sage
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Seek out the prophecies raved by the ancient worm-sage in his dilapidated monastery, and contend with its monstrous conquerors!

boardgame.name: A Debt for the Dead
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Your entire party lies broken and battered on the ground, victims of a cunning trap they happened upon somewhere in the Perigosa Cave. Adding insult to injury, Death was busy this day and sent in his stead, his young assistant, Torrac. But Torrac was hasty and collected the PC's souls before they could attempt to evade the trap... which, it turns out, they would have.

boardgame.name: Bingo's Fun House
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

A halfling carnival barker shouts, “You think you are a great adventurer!? Come prove your worth in Bingo’s Fun
House!”

Bingo the Clown has set up a series of challenges to test the most daring and confident adventurers. Each room is more daring than the last. Be careful… Three strikes, and you’re out! A small sign reads, “ABSOLUTELY NO REFUNDS!!!”

boardgame.name: Steal the Walking Tower
Walk Away Tower
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

The evil wizard, Gon, and most of his apprentices are dead, recently destroyed in his tower by adventurers he betrayed. Alcatar, a former apprentice, seeks your help to now steal the tower.

User summary:

Intended as a sequel to Plumbing the Depths

boardgame.name: Canal City Heist
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

An adventure for 4-6 5th-rank characters.

Otto Blung asks the party to steal a mysterious metal box from Weldon Shul, a well-known shady entrepreneur based in Lowtown. He will pay each party member 250 GP to break into Shul's mansion, grab the 12 x 12 x 12 inch box and bring it to Janis's Rendezvous. Shul is out of the city on business tonight.

boardgame.name: The Flooded Factory
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Trying to create the ultimate being, Kallen made many horrific creatures using a powerful sphere. The device he created to control sphere's power broke, and his attempts to shut off the device were unsuccessful. His body started to dissolve before he could reach the sphere. He has remained there, so close to the edge of his journey, for hundreds of years. Removing the power source is the only way to end his curse.

boardgame.name: Atout Carreaux
Fliesen im Spiel
Tiles: The Name of the Game
boardgame.description:
Tiles: The Name of the Game is a promotional game by Villeroy & Boch for their 250th anniversary. It was produced by Ravensburger.

Get your room board tiled with the help of two floor tilers. Collect different kind of tiles and and win with the most valuable pieces.

boardgame.name: The Lair of the Fire Witch
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

For 6-8 characters of levels 12-13 or 4-5 characters of levels 14-15. The Lair of the Fire Witch can be discovered by adventurers 100 clicks from any civilization, deep in the scorching desert. Most intruders that far into the desert are likely to die from heat stroke or dehydration. Those who manage to cling to life in the desert may mistake it for a mirage. Native nomads won’t go closer than 20 clicks out. The nomads will not answer questions about The Lair except to say that it is a compendium of heinous evil. Those who seek The Lair of the Fire Witch are giving their souls to damnation.

boardgame.name: The Dungeons of Neraz Level One
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

The Oddball Wizard "Neraz" has constructed many underground dungeons where he stores his stolen treasures. The party has found one.

boardgame.name: Sentient Limbs of the World, Unite!
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Lost on the Outskirts this dungeon commune boils with REVOLUTIONARY fervour. SENTIENT DISEMBODIED LIMBS hatch schemes for ending centuries of grotesque oppression, exploitation and cruel neglect perpetrated by the BODIED CLASS.

Authorities deny rumours of impending violence yet YOU are SECRETLY sent to:


INFILTRATE the Commune;
EVICT the Revolutionaries;
END the Sentient Menace!

boardgame.name: The Rescue of Dr. Mori
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

In the year of 2077 the world is heavily marked by the current ongoing war between three factions, The Phoenix Alliance (PA), The Blue Horizon (BH) and The Eternal Earth (EE). The players are mercenaries hired by the PA to infiltrate a heavily armed BH spaceship transporting Dr. Mori, a recently captured Ballistic Engineer, and other prisoners from PA, their mission is to bring him back alive.

boardgame.name: Razor Edge
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

It’s a typical night around the table until Tommy shows up with a mystical gem. It seems to glow and pulsate, its presence drawing everyone in the room. All at once, your hands reach out to grasp it, and as you do, your group is violently transported to another world. Materializing on a hard metal surface, floating through an abyss of space and sound, you see your friends dressed in a variety of denim spandex and neon color. Before you, approaches a man of plastic with long, dark hair, a large smile and outstretched arms. “Welcome to Razor Edge, we’ve been waiting for you.”

“What is this place!” you inquire.

boardgame.name: The Riven Tower
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

The Warlock of Netherspire was renowned for his ability to summon – and banish – almost any entity. His manse sat on a charming peak…until ripped asunder by a rival’s sorcery, just as he was midsummoning! Now the ruins barely cling to the edges of a steep canyon. Lately, dreadful moans have been heard, and people are disappearing nightly. Can his secrets be recovered?

Would-be explorers are advised to bring plenty of rope.

boardgame.name: SEEKRIEG 5: Ship Logs â€“ Italy 1880-1945
boardgame.description:
This collection of the SEEKRIEG 5 ship logs, originally released on CD in 2009, represents the majority of the vessels comprising the navies of Italy during the years 1880 to 1945. Any subsequent corrections made to the original release are included in this set of files.

A total of 986 ship logs are included and, wherever possible, planned warships, conversions and never completed vessels are also included and based on available information. In most instances, one or more logs are provided for individual ships within a particular class. Major refits or other modifications significantly affecting the fighting capability of a ship are reflected in the multiple logs available for some ships, however, details regarding individual modifications to some of the smaller vessels (torpedo boats, submarines, gunboats and MTBs) are not generally available so a single ship log is provided to serve for the entire class.

boardgame.name: The New Marvel-Phile (Issue 40)
boardgame.description: Presenting the first of our July Marvel Philes: the giant sized #40 The British Invasion part 2. Thanks to Richard Green, George Henson and Simon Barns.

boardgame.name: The Ancient Museum
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Once a place of wonder, known across the world. Thought to be destroyed long ago. Recently a dangerous group of bandits has begun using it as a hideout...

boardgame.name: The Garden of Blood and Ivory
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

The characters have heard rumors of an elephant's graveyard in a desert oasis and gone in search of it, or have stumbled across the oasis by accident. The oasis does exist, and elephants are drawn there, eventually to die. Ivory can be found (when tusks are found as a random encounter, it is an elephant carcass with tusks worth 1d6x100gp, weighing 1lb per 4gp value, each live elephant has tusks of this value as well), but watch out for the elephants. The plant life of the oasis is dominated by red musk creepers (similar to yellow musk creepers, except that the flowers specifically target large herbivores rather than humanoids). Elephants and other herbivores (including the party's mounts) are sprayed by the hypnotic pollen and will remain in the oasis, attacking other animals and stomping them into the soil to fertilize the creepers. But only thick-skinned animals like elephants and rhinos last more than one day here, before the inhabitants of the spire get to them.

boardgame.name: Flight to the City of Refuge
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

A pointcrawl for 1-3 low level characters

You’re wandering through a low-magic, stone-age coastal region when you come to a kingdom ruled by a powerful King. His strict code of laws is enforced by a brutal cadre of helmeted warriors. Unfortunately, one of you has violated the sacred law by (roll) and sentenced on the spot to (roll).

boardgame.name: The Well Wisher
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

When someone throws a coin into a wishing well the intense desire, longing, pain or sorrow of the person imbues the coin with a fragment of magical energy. Sometimes there is enough energy to make the wish come true. Other times though, the coins gather at the bottom of the well with their magical energy unspent. They sit, wait, attract. Foul creatures exist that feed on the unspent energy, the sadness, infused in these coins.

boardgame.name: Lord Caldrich's Manor
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Lord Caldrich's Manor is home to the legendary Staplemark tapestry, telling the tale of King Calodoric. The remote manor itself was built by his descendant on a castle as old as time. The tapestry stretches without end on each of its dark walls.

You were sent here by your friend Lady Ada Chegwin to investigate the disappearance of her son Arnold. This man has lived in the manor for a year, and was last seen here a week ago.

boardgame.name: Nightingale
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

The story of the nightingale.

There used to be a bird with a song so sweet. That injured men would get back to their feet. This bird was here to mend any ail. He was called the nightingale.

boardgame.name: Planar Paintball Fight
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

A multiplanar magical experiment has gone haywire, releasing devils, rock monsters, and mythic warriors. Before the barrier is destroyed, adventurers have one chance to take some magical wands, load them up with fluid from astral color pools, and splat the monsters to send them back to their original planes.

boardgame.name: The Demon Heart of the Deathtree
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Many generations ago, this Tree was the heart of the Elven Kingdom. However, the demon Yad deceived the elves and corrupted the Tree. The elves fled, and only through their ultimate sacrifice could the elven wizards contain Yad's evil, banishing him back to the Abyss. The forest was left uninhabited, and the stories of ancient curses made it a place to avoid.

boardgame.name: The Vacant Chateaux
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Hobgoblins have been attacking merchants and farmsteads. Their hideout a vacant chateaux.

boardgame.name: Epitaph
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Your friend Ossia is dead. Her last wish was to be buried atop a mountain in her homeland, but the dead find no peace in this troubled kingdom. Break the curse, or Ossia will rise and seek revenge on her faithless friends.

boardgame.name: Heroes and Minions
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Starting when the adventurers enter through the iron doors, the Dungeon Heart initiates its Plan, summoning Minions as listed below, multiplied by the number of adventurers. Summoned Minions move towards the Dungeon Heart and any adventurers inside along an invisible path (purple) in single-file and unaffected by obstructions. If their attack wouldn’t reach an adventurer, they move a 2nd time instead. They ignore any ghostly Heroes. Minions on the map attack adventurers they see, pursuing until victory or death.

The adventurers will need help to not be overrun, and spirits of long-lost Heroes fill this place. Luckily, those Heroes can be empowered to help the adventurers fight off the endless Minions closing in behind them.

boardgame.name: Ungle-Wold's Beach
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Gloomy Forest Glade (the air breathes heavy, the smell of "green"). Oppressive trees surround (lush oaks strangling the light from the air). Mossy dolmen (in the center of the glade, half lost in the growth). Opening in dolmen (dark, hidden among the undergrowth, a pokey crawl down to [room one].

boardgame.name: The Hexwastes
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Slender obsidian walkways loom precipitously out of the thick fog in a huge hexagonal grid that stretches many days travel hence. They are very slippery, slightly convex, and impervious to mundane damage. Anyone falling has a few moments to scream before they disappear out of sight into the depths of the fog.

boardgame.name: The Heist at Button's Bank
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

You’ve followed the guardsmen to the bank. It is just like you suspected: all of the city’s contraband gets stashed inside Burton Button’s Bank. These corrupt pigs are going to pay for their transgressions. Tonight you will breach their famous vaults and bleed them for everything they have.

boardgame.name: Stranger Games & the Twilight of the Slayers
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

It was another average day at Averton High until the new students showed up. They seem unusual. They also seem... very eligible. Befriend these newcomers to save the world - and find your one true love!

boardgame.name: The Curse of the Goblin Tomb
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

For the last few months goblins have been stealing occasional sheep or two. Recently they started taking cows and a dog. You have been hired to stop it.

boardgame.name: Dimensional Den
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

A wizard is known as Ulter, the “Southpaw,” who discovered the terrible secret of traveling with portals. However, because it was mighty magic, he was unable to control it and ended up creating an area of instability in his old magic laboratory. Ulter is gone, but rumors that in his laboratory there is a legendary treasure, as well as the secret of this powerful magic, have attracted adventurers. However, a curse remains on the spot: each time an adventurer explores it, the place is never the same, and if this treasure exists, it seems that Ulter has disappeared with it. Is the challenge launched, ready to take a chance?

boardgame.name: A City of Philosophers with Clubs
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Unbeknown to anyone, the city has been the field of a metaphysical battle that could lead to nothing less than its entire displacement to another plane of existence. Each alignment will try to influence people to become the prevailing philosophy. To further their goal, each has an avatar in a position of power.

Will the PCs join one of these factions or will they free the city from this fearful fate?

boardgame.name: The Crying Cricket Tavern
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

A cellar tavern for goblins at the bottom of a long and windy stair in a most unexpected place. Locals include: Old Squeazand, proprietor. Horrible hacking cough, raspy voice. Fears outsiders are here just to rough up his patrons and rob him or demand bribes. Extremely greedy and untrusting. Poisoned crossbow at hand. Would rent Purple Room out. Fears a vampire abides in the sarcophagus, slumbering away in an astral dream.

boardgame.name: Maw of Snails
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

North of the dry hills, East of the Pyre Sea, ancient diggings wound the earth. The Maw of Snails, a black shaft that births gastropod horrors each night to burn and wither in the unforgiving sun. Venerated as a portal to the underworld by the shepherd folk, scholars proclaim it a magical sink, a polluted arcane cyst, hoarding the lost treasures of history.

boardgame.name: Rubik's Cube Random Dungeon
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

The six faces of the cube generate six aspects for each location. The colour of each central square relates to one of these six aspects[.]

boardgame.name: Vault of the Gargoyle Mage
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

The Entrance to the dungeon is a pair of doors approximately 5’ wide by 10’ tall, magically sealed and locked. They can be opened by spell or by extraordinary efforts in lockpicking.

boardgame.name: Adrist in Time
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

You have entered an Alteration Device Reinforcing the Integrity of Subjective Time — a “time machine”, or ADRIST.

boardgame.name: Stela Obliterata
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

In a sacred plaza stands a diorite monolith, tall as a stretching ogre. Four inscriptions on this stela tell of evildoers in the 4th Epoch, banished after death to the "shadow of the sunset," their cryptic crimes in date order, names chiselled out ("XXX").

boardgame.name: Terror on the Arkham Express
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Arkham, Massachusetts, 1926. The party boards an express train for a three-day ride to Chicago. But strange happenings begin to occur. It turns out to be the work of cultists worshipping Yth'hawal, the elder god of darkness. The cultists must be passengers on the train, but who?

Little does the party know that the train is in fact destined for Yth'hawal's realm of darkness, as a sacrifice to the dark god. Can the party identify the cultists and stop them before it's too late?

boardgame.name: The Maw That Swallows
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Supplies have been going missing in the nearby settlement close to the sea. With one local saying they saw "walking fish" disappearing into the cove cave not far from here with crates and barrels in their mouths. It is now your group's goal to find out why they are taking all these supplies.

boardgame.name: Bug Rapport
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

There are three towers built along the snowy mountains. They receive radio signals for unknown purposes.

boardgame.name: Welcome to Dying
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Run this scenario when a Player Character dies.

This is a system-agnostic Dungeon. Play it with your favorite game rules. Behold the image and describe the scene as it pleases you...

Don’t worry about spatial references - the realmof the dead has its own dimensionality. Be weird! Ask questions and build the lore as you go.

boardgame.name: Temple of the Rose
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Through generations travels the memory of heroes who climbed the rose, in which shadow forests fell from old age. One day the rose dried up and the myth was born. Its magic had not been extinguished but had instead been imprisoned by wizards in an underground temple, where they were studying ways to tame the magic of the rose.

boardgame.name: The Cheese Thugs
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Entering the small berg of Middleton, the players read a public notice posted on a tree saying, “WANTED: The Cheese Thugs, dead or alive. Reward: 80 gold coins. All inquirers see Local Militia Leader, Gop, at the blacksmith shop.”

boardgame.name: Are You Smarter than a Kobold?
boardgame.description: The Kobolds have found a way through this trap-filled sanctuary to the treasure left behind. Are the heroes smart enough to follow it?

boardgame.name: Old School Revival
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

The dead are not staying down at the Voorlarian Institute for Applied Thaumaturgy.

boardgame.name: The Mechanus Lock
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

The party must pick a lock - from the inside! The lock is magically protected, located adjacent the plane of Mechanus and guarded by Modrons.

boardgame.name: The True Dungeon is the Friends You Make Along the Way
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

There is always rooms equal to the number of players. If you have 5 players, there are 5 rooms. The DM should generate these rooms before the game.

boardgame.name: Bound for Glory
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

The big chess match between heaven and hell is coming up. You and your teen angel friends have yet to earn your wings but are looking to prove yourselves. As members of the junior varsity team, your plan is to steal the mascot of the rival team. Their mascot, the three headed hellhound puppy Cerby, is currently en route with Hell’s chess team on the afterlife express.

boardgame.name: Effishy
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

A deranged cleric has kidnapped a town’s leader and stolen a ceremonial effigy ahead of the seasonal festivities. The cleric has been holed up in a discreet cave in the surrounding wilderness.

The massive cavern houses a seemingly depthless lake. A string of islands, littered with the ruins of a forgotten fortress, extend from the shoreline. A broken cobble road meanders through ancient archways, over a broken bridge, and up a steep cliff to a fortified tower atop the tallest island.

boardgame.name: The Wailing Manticore
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

The Cave...

...lies high up the slope of a craggy mountain, rumoured to be the lair of a flying monster that steals shiny trinkets from passing merchants.

Recently, a wailing howl has been heard coming from the cave, and local merchants want it to stop, for it is affecting their business. Any treasure found there can be kept by whoever is brave enough to venture inside, put a stop to the howling, and maybe an end to the monster too.

boardgame.name: The Day of Fools
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Muddrick, a wizard’s apprentice, was sick of constantly being ordered around by his boss. He tried to cast a Reverse Authority spell, but everything’s gone a bit wrong. Now the rules of authority have been shifted all across town, and nobody can leave. Can the PCs figure out how to break the curse?

boardgame.name: Sutter Cane's Perilous Peninsula
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

It's always late fall. The soundtrack is VHS-warped. Somehow, you're stuck here until you've figured out what's going on and something explodes.

boardgame.name: RAF: The Battle of Britain 1940 â€“ Deluxe Edition Kit
boardgame.description:
This is an update kit for first (2009) and second (2013) printings of RAF: The Battle of Britain 1940 to update them to third deluxe printing (2019).

Contents:

Double sided mounted board
3 Color Rule Booklets
4 double sided Player Aid Cards

boardgame.name: Corona Yuga
boardgame.description:
The pandemic situation has imposed a lockdown on all of humankind. Veer Kashyap (Age 9Yrs 9Months), a class 5 student at Army Public School, New Delhi, had gone to visit his grandparents in Bengaluru during the academic break and got stuck due to lockdown. To overcome the boredom, he decided to design a board game on his own when our Prime Minister announced 21 days of lockdown. He understood the COVID-19 scenario through media and came up with a board game, which he named CORONA YUGA, meaning Corona Era. He designed the layout, drew it on a cardboard and completed using material available at home, and started playing with family.

Board games are a fun and effective way of introducing new concepts to children of all ages and Corona Yuga aims to create awareness in a most interesting manner and spend time together at home during lockdown period. The board game designed like the infamous corona virus, promotes Yoga & Social Distancing and also appreciates COVID Warriors for their services to mankind. This fun game played by ages 5+ will entertain everyone in future years, about the present scenario faced by each one of us.

boardgame.name: Tradition: Sandheart Volume 3
boardgame.description:
From the Introduction:

For hundreds of years, and for one day in every year, braziers have been lit in an ancient cave near Sandheart and left to burn for the night. This is the militia’s task - to ensure that this tradition, its purpose long forgotten, is completed. With the Hero Wars nearing, forces are stirring that wish otherwise.

boardgame.name: Dirty Mining
boardgame.description:
Story:
It’s the end of the twentieth century and you are in a post-soviet country in Europe. The main way to make a living is mineral mining. The market situation is very bad in the country troubled by corruption and high criminality. Market prices are barely enough to cover costs. The only way to make a decent living is to mine minerals supported by the government. The catch is that the government places subsidies just before the minerals are sold. This means you need to corrupt government officials to place subsidies in your favor.

Game basics:
The game is for up to five players. Each player represents a mine owner. The goal of the game is to make enough money to leave the country in three years by corrupting government officials, stealing, snitching or by exploiting miners.

Each year is divided into four quarters. One turn is one quarter. Each quarter is divided into three months (actions), which means one player gets three actions each turn.
In total, each player gets three actions each turn and four turns each year.

At the end of each year, the government gives subsidies and sets market prices.

The game ends at the end of the third year (the twelfth turn). Players sell their minerals as usually and then count their money. The player with the most money wins. If there is a tie, the player with higher ranking card wins.

-description from designer

boardgame.name: CortiÃ§a
boardgame.description:
Cork (Cortiça, in Portuguese. /kuÉ¾Ëˆti.sÉ/) is one of the most characteristic natural products from Portugal. In this game the players will plant cork oaks, extract their bark and process it into cork.

Every turn the players will shuffle the five actions and make a line of four. Those actions can have one or two spaces in which the players will place their workers.
The actions are resolved from left to right, up to down. When an action is resolved the worker goes in a stack. On the next turn, the players will draw and place the workers from the stack, one by one.

Cortiça was designed for Button Shy's 18 card worker placement challenge. It was one of the 10 finalists - out of 150+ games!
It's about cork! The material, not the city.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Grim Hollow - The Campaign Guide
boardgame.description:
Publisher Blurb:

Do you dare set foot within the world of Etharis?

A god-less, unforgiving, war-torn world filled with Curses, Plagues & Ghoulish Creatures. A civilization that has long forgotten hope and now clings on desperately for survival.

Will you be the one to lead those who have lost hope into a new-age of peace?

Or will you succumb to the Darkness and decimate anything that stumbles across your path?

Discover a World in Desperate Need of Heroes
In a world that is brimming with history, depth, culture & conflict, players will fight for every small victory and mourn every loss as the very world itself fights back.

Transform Yourself in a Hunt for Power
Within Grim Hollow there are over five different Player Character transformations available; each with their own diverse range of pros and cons.

Invoke Supernatural Powers and lay waste to those who Oppose You.
Featuring a diverse array of new spells & feats, as well as the addition of Curses; you will find that there is always a means to an end…for a price.

Flesh Out Your Character’s with Unique Motivations and Goals.
Containing a completely rebuilt Background System with a host of new feats and abilities, you’re character can start as a simple peasant and arise to the role of powerful Crime Lord. Forge your own pathway.

If you’ve been searching for an in-depth resource overflowing with lore, notable NPC’s, a range of new mechanics, items and spells; An imaginative, gripping and downright fear-inducing campaign guide then prepare yourself, for you have stumbled upon what you seek.

Welcome, to Etharis… We’ll see if you survive...

boardgame.name: Marvel Champions: The Card Game â€“ Single Player Mat
boardgame.description:
Battle evil in style with the Marvel Champions LCG: Single Player Mat.

This 24”x 12 slip-resistant game mat gives you plenty of space for your hero’s deck, identity card, upgrades, supports, and more while showing off beautiful art of your favorite Marvel heroes! The villains don’t stand a chance!

—description from the publisher
boardgame.boardgameaccessory: Marvel Champions: The Card Game â€“ Black Widow Hero Pack
Marvel Champions: The Card Game â€“ Captain America Hero Pack
Marvel Champions: The Card Game â€“ Doctor Strange Hero Pack
Marvel Champions: The Card Game â€“ Hulk Hero Pack
Marvel Champions: The Card Game â€“ Ms. Marvel Hero Pack
Marvel Champions: The Card Game â€“ The Rise of Red Skull
Marvel Champions: The Card Game â€“ Thor Hero Pack

boardgame.name: Dark Souls: The Board Game â€“ Extra Dice Pack
boardgame.description:
Dice for Dark Souls: The Board Game.

One Pack contains 15 dice.


4 green - dodge
5 black - for level 1 attacks (max 1 sword symbol)
4 blue - for level 2 attacks (max 2 swords symbol)
2 orange - for legendary level 3 attacks (max 3 swords symbol)


They were available in reopening of Backerkit in November 2017.

boardgame.name: Valor & Villainy: Minions of Mordak â€“ Extra Engraved Dice
boardgame.description:
Dice for Valor & Villainy: Minions of Mordak.

One set contains 18 deluxe engraved dice.


6 red - for level 3 attacks
6 white - for level 1 attacks
6 yellow - for level 2 attacks

boardgame.name: Dark Souls: The Board Game â€“ Metal Aggro Coin
boardgame.description:
The Metal Aggro Coin for Dark Souls: The Board Game is Kickstarter Exclusive.

It replaces the cardboard Aggro token which is in the base game of Dark Souls: The Board Game.

boardgame.name: Moto X3M Bike Race Game
boardgame.description:
User Summary

Moto X3M Bike Race Game is a bike racing game over obstacles and the aim is to beat the clock on timed levels with checkpoints.

boardgame.name: Serengeti: A Safari Board Game
boardgame.description:
Serengeti is a family game, combining strategy and a bit of luck, set in the “endless plains” of Africa. Each player will be tasked with managing a new national park for 4 years, while collecting victory points with the goal of developing their park into the most popular in Africa.

Everyone will have their own mat where they will arrange the animals in their park as well as any workers they hire and vehicles they purchase. Each gameplay item has a unique ability, so the player must plan carefully and play the ones that will help them build the best park.

Every player starts with 5 Safari Cards and each year they must decide whether or not to play one. Depending on the animals currently in their park they’ll receive different benefits and victory points when playing one, so players must keep an eye on which Safari Cards they have and when the best time to play them would be.

Each turn consists of moving your token to another tile and performing a simple action shown on the tile such as: obtaining resources, drawing or playing an animal or action card, hiring workers, purchasing vehicles, or hosting a safari. After each player has had a turn, a month is considered to have passed in the game. With quick turns, gameplay moves at a brisk pace and players will be eager to have another turn.

The game has limited vehicles and workers, different safaris, and a constantly changing map, making every time you play a unique and different experience. Select your strategy, plan ahead, and create the best park in all of Africa!

boardgame.name: Das Neue Ã„therversum Band 2
boardgame.description:
From backcover:

Das Neue Ätherversum ist eine Fibel des Wissens, die Groß und Klein, Alt und Jung, Dorfburschen und edle Fräulein über interessante Entdeckungen und famose Erfindungen unserer modernen Welt unterhält und belehrt und mit Wort und Bild über verschiedenste Bereiche menschlichen und außerirdischen Wissens und Könnens, wie es Tag für Tag in immer schnellerem Galopp voranschreitet, aufklärt und informiert. In Hütte, Palast oder Ätherzeppelin – einem jedem interessierten Leser soll Das Neue Ätherversum lehrreiche Unterhaltung und nützliches Nachschlagewerk sein, das man stets gern zur Hand nimmt.

Willkommen zur zweiten Ausgabe des Neuen Ätherversums – ein Ingame-Almanach aus dem alternativen 19. Jahrhundert, gleichzeitig ein Quellenbuch für Space: 1889. Der Tradition seines Vorgängers folgend ist der Band wieder reich an Artikeln aus Forschung, Entdeckung und Kultur – geschrieben aus zeitgenössischer Perspektive, dabei immer mit einem Abenteuer- oder Science-Fiction-Twist.

Während der Hauptteil als Inspiration für Spieler des Rollenspiels gedacht ist (und im weiteren Sinn für Fans viktorianischer oder wilhelminischer Science Fiction), liefert ein umfangreicher Anhang Regelerweiterungen, Hintergründe und Abenteueraufhänger zu den Beiträgen. Damit kann der Spielleiter die Inhalte in die eigene Kampagne einflechten, ein abendfüllendes Szenario um eines der Themen stricken oder mehrere Ideen zu einem längeren Abenteuer verknüpfen.

Nun denn, Neues Ätherversum, ziehe aus in die weite Welt, erhelle den Geist von Groß und Klein, Jung und Alt, erleuchte den Kaufmann wie den Handwerksburschen, die Gouvernante wie den Ätherkapitän, und werfe dein Licht in jeden Winkel des bekannten Universums, das Licht des 19. Jahrhunderts!

Aus dem Inhalt:
Detektei Deisenroth
Gefahren der Reisen im Ätherraum
24 Stunden in der Orbitalstation
Neue Ufer – Expeditionsbericht der „Venushexen“
Die meistgesuchten Verbrecher des Sonnensystems

boardgame.name: Kinect Saban's Power Rangers Super Samurai
boardgame.description:
Based on Saban’s Power Rangers Super Samurai players of all ages will be able to join the Rangers as they physically immerse themselves into the morphing action of the iconic team of heroes using the power of the Kinect sensor.

Power Rangers Super Samurai will let fans master the elements of Fire, Water, Sky, Forest, and Earth as they morph into Red, Blue, Pink, Green, or Yellow Rangers. Martial arts training and fitness modes will teach the importance of teamwork, friendship, and responsibility that is needed to battle the evil Master Xandred and the malevolent Serrator. Players will also be able to help the Samurai Rangers use the legendary Black Box to create all new MegaZord combinations and become Super Samurai.

boardgame.name: Ahora o Nunca
Now or Never
boardgame.description:
Far to the south of The Last Ruin lies a cliffside village called The Monument. For generations, it protected an ancient shrine until the day a crystal meteorite descended. The meteor's denizens slowly crept out into the world—bizarre monstrosities from nightmare, attacking all in their path. As they spread across the land, there was no intelligent malice nor grand invasion strategy; the creatures acted like a fungus—spreading into new territory sporadically. After many fruitless attempts to expel the monsters, the people of The Monument fled as their village crumbled, exiled to distant lands, resigned to a nomadic existence.

Twenty years later, there are rumors that the bizarre monsters are growing weak. They’re slower, less impervious to attack, some undergoing a gradual petrification until they crumble to dust. Is it the atmosphere? Are they dying of old age? Do they suffer from a strange disease? No one is certain, but as the news spreads, various factions set their eyes on the vacant, ruined village of The Monument. The original villagers, now refugees, are desperate to return and rebuild. But they must do it quickly, before someone else claims their home. This is their chance. It’s now or never.

In Now or Never, you and up to three friends compete to best rebuild your ancestral village and guide the rest of the villagers on their journey home. Although the creatures of the meteorite have lost much of their strength, many of them remain, and you must fight them off to protect traveling villagers. Now or Never is the third game in the Arzium storybook series that includes Above and Below and Near and Far.

Now or Never is a competitive strategy game that allows you to:


Choose one of four asymmetrical characters to play.
Rebuild the village so that returning villagers have a place to live. You must carefully choose what and where to build to maintain an advantage, earning the biggest rewards for long-term planning.
Interact with other players by hiring their specialists to perform special actions.
Combat dangerous creatures to rescue villagers.
Explore a fantasy landscape filled with bizarre places, technology, and peoples.


Now or Never includes two modes of play: standard and story. When playing in story mode, you read from a storybook when you explore, making choices and learning more about the characters and the world. Each character has their own set of stories, unique to the locations they explore and diverse in plot, perspective, and motive, allowing you to choose what direction your own story will take.

Journey to The Monument and help rebuild your ancient home!

-description from publisher
